headline: Investors Are Flocking to Figma. Why Is the Design Software Maker's Stock So Hot?
summary: Touted as the David to Adobe’s Goliath, design software upstart Figma’s stock could be quickly catching up after a stronger trading debut than even it expected.

headline: Adobe’s Failed Acquisition of Figma Has Cost the Company Over $38 Billion and Counting — Here’s How High It Could Go
summary: Adobe’s $20 billion Figma acquisition failed amid regulatory scrutiny, costing $1 billion and missing a $37 billion post-IPO windfall.

summary: Figma stock was rising again after the biggest ever first-day gain for an IPO which raised more than $500 million.

headline: Figma's blockbuster IPO could fuel wave of new listings
summary: Figma's (FIG) initial public offering (IPO) surged 250%, far surpassing its earlier $20 billion acquisition offer from Adobe (ADBE) that was blocked by UK regulators. Ramzan Karmali, host of Yahoo Finance's Morning Brief: Market Sunrise, explains how this IPO could spark a wave of listings for venture-backed startups. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: Design software maker Figma extends gains after blockbuster NYSE trading debut
summary: (Reuters) -Design software maker Figma's shares surged another 20% in morning trading on Friday, extending strong debut-day gains after a blowout U.S. initial public offering that has reignited the tech listing market.  The 250% surge lifted Figma's market value to nearly $68 billion, far exceeding the $20-billion valuation in a now-scrapped buyout deal with Photoshop maker Adobe.  Figma's $1.22-billion offering, the fourth-largest U.S. IPO of the year, is being seen as a potential catalyst for other startups eyeing a flotation after a three-year freeze in the tech listings market.

raw.headline: Design software maker Figma extends gains after blockbuster NYSE trading debut
raw.summary: (Reuters) -Design software maker Figma's shares surged another 20% in morning trading on Friday, extending strong debut-day gains after a blowout U.S. initial public offering that has reignited the tech listing market. Figma's $1.22-billion offering, the fourth-largest U.S. IPO of the year, is being seen as a potential catalyst for other startups eyeing a flotation after a three-year freeze in the tech listings market.
